item.description:
Don't use your GPS!! The visitor center is in Lincoln R.I on I-295 north, north of exit 9.

The Blackstone river rail trail runs approximately 11 miles from Lincoln to Woonsocket RI. Its very nice, meandering along woods and streams. We can meet at the Blackstone River Visitor Center on RT 295 in RI. From Boston, take 95S into RI, then 295-S ( at exit 4 ). Go to exit 9 and turn around to be headed back North-the Center is on 295 North bound side. There is a Duncan Donuts, restrooms, and plenty of parking, and the trailhead access is behind the building. Meet in the parking lot.

$1 suggested donation for the organizer fee

Lunch afterwards at
Jackys Galaxie restaurant
1764 Mendon Rd
Cumberland RI
401.333.4700

http://www.nps.gov/bl...

Blackstone River State Park Visitor Center
Interstate 295 North
Lincoln, RI 02895

Located on Interstate 295 North, in-between Exits 9 and 10, the Blackstone River State Park Visitor Center is open twenty four hours a day. Along with tourist information, the Visitor Center also provides facilities and concessions, as well as a State Police satellite office. The Visitor Center is also directly linked to the Blackstone River Bikeway and provides access to the Blackstone River State Park which includes the Blackstone River, the historic Blackstone Canal and the Captain Wilbur Kelly House Transportation Museum via a half mile bikeway link.

Directions
The Visitor Center is located on Interstate 295 North, between exits 9 and 10.
item.how_to_find_us: Bike trail access is in back of the visitor center
item.name: Blackstone River Rail Trail Lincoln RI
